entry.title: Comment on "Observation of the e/3 fractionally charged Laughlin quasiparticles" and "Direct Observation of Fractional Charge"
entry.summary: comment on cond-mat/97063007 and cond-mat/9707289

entry.title: On the ground state of fractional quantum Hall effect
entry.summary: The paper has bene withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: A physical realization of the quantum superalgebra sl_q(2/1)
entry.summary: The article has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: On the Degeneracy of the Quantum Hall Effect Wavefunction on the torus
entry.summary: The article has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: Unconventional clustering of discrete energy levels in an ultrasmall Au grain
entry.summary: This papaer has been withdrawn

entry.title: Quantum Antidots: Coulomb Blockade or no Coulomb Blockade?
entry.summary: Comment on M. Kataoka et al., Phys. Rev. Lett. 83, 160 (1999).

entry.title: Spin Tunneling in Fe$_8$ Molecular Nanomagnets [Comment on Europhys. Lett. 47, 722, 1999, by Del Barco et al.]
entry.summary: Spin Tunneling in Fe8 powder : a comment on Europhys. Lett. 47, 722, 1999, by Del Berco et al.

entry.title: Electron-electron interaction correction to conductivity in quasiballistic limit
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: Magnetic domain walls as mesoscopic objects
entry.summary: This is an intoduction to the theory of the essentially mesoscopic phenomena for the magnetic domain walls.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages, in Russian, Lectures given at the XIV SBSS

entry.title: Remark on the Comment (cond-mat/0304626) by Fal'ko, Lerner, Tsyplyatyev,Aleiner
entry.summary: We remark on the validity of the concerns raised in the comment(cond-mat/0304626) by Fal'ko, Lerner, Tsyplyatyev, and Aleiner..

entry.title: Comment on "Magnetic response of Disordered Metallic Rings: Large Contributions of Far Levels"
entry.summary: Comment on cond-mat/0205390; PRL 90, 026805 (2003)

entry.title: Spin Hall Conductance in Disordered Two-Dimensional Electron Systems
entry.summary: We withdraw the paper because the results are wrong.

entry.title: Temperature dependent PL from SWNTs
entry.summary: Photoluminescence (PL) and photoluminescence excitation (PLE) spectroscopy of pillar-suspended single-walled carbon nanotubes has been measured for temperatures between 300 K and 5 K.

entry.title: Topologization of electron liquids with Chern-Simons theory and quantum computation
entry.summary: We discuss a nexus among quantum topology, quantum physics and quantum computing.

entry.title: Reply to Comment: S. Das Sarma et al., arXiv:0708.3239
entry.summary: The authors of the Comment ascribe us claims never made while moderating their own previous unsubstantiated statements.

entry.title: Noise induced decoherence in quantum dots
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author and replaced by arXiv:0809.4751

entry.title: Comment on "Molecular Transport Junctions: Clearing Mists"
entry.summary: This is a comment to a review article by Lindsay and Ratner titled "Molecular Transport Junctions: Clearing Mists".

entry.title: Direct measurement and the diameter-dependence of minority carrier diffusion length in individual ZnO nanowires
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: On defect-induced magnetism and bang opening in graphene
entry.summary: We discuss several mechanisms of magnetism and band opening in graphene produced by its hydrogenation and fluorination that can be examined experimentally.

entry.title: Memristor: Why do we have to know about it?
entry.summary: Review on Memristor.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: IETE Technical Review, Vol.26 (1), pp.3-6, January-February 2009

entry.title: Comment on "Chiral tunnelling and the Klein paradox in graphene"
entry.summary: Arising from the Article: Nature Phys. 2, 620-625 (2006), By M. I. Katsnelson, K. S. Novoselov, and A. K. Geim.

entry.title: Correlation effects and spin dependent transport in carbon nanostructures
entry.summary: The impact of symmetry breaking perturbations on the spin dependent transport through carbon nanotube quantum dots in the Kondo regime is discussed.

entry.title: Geometric Phases and Topological Effects
entry.summary: Lecture Notes of the 45th IFF Spring School "Computing Solids - Models, ab initio methods and supercomputing" (Forschungszentrum Juelich, 2014).

entry.title: A Review of Proximity Effect Correction in Electron-beam Lithography
entry.summary: I review the work of proximity effect correction (PEC) in electron-beam (e-beam) lithography with emphasis on dose modification and shape modification PEC techniques.

entry.title: Fundamental Limits to Moore's Law
entry.summary: The theoretical and practical aspects of the fundamental, ultimate, physical limits to scaling, or Moore-s law, is presented.

entry.title: Spin Mechanics
entry.summary: A brief history, the current state, and future directions of spin mechanics are presented.

entry.title: Comment on "Laser refrigeration of hydrothermal nanocrystals in physiological media"
entry.summary: The recent report on laser cooling of liquid may contradict the law of energy conservation.

entry.title: Anisotropic Phonon Transport, Thermal Expansion and Thermomechanics in Monolayer Td-WTe2
entry.summary: In this paper, we elaborately investigate the phonon transport, thermal expansion and thermomechanics of monolayer Td-WTe2 by using first-principles.

entry.title: Generalized dispersion of the edge plasmon modes of two-dimensional Dirac materials
entry.summary: Here, the dispersion of edge surface plasmon polariton (SPP) modes is expressed in terms of the elements of the conductivity tensor.

entry.title: Comment on ``Fundamental relation between electrical and thermoelectric transport coefficients in the quantum Hall regime''
entry.summary: Paper withdrawn due to errors. Revised version may or may not appear in the future.

entry.title: Chaos and Interactions : Statistics of Hartree-Fock Levels in Small Disordered Systems
entry.summary: This paper is presently under revision and amendments. It will be posted soon.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper is presently under revision and amendments. It will be posted soon.

entry.title: Comment on ''Lack of Destructive Interference of Landau Edge States in the Quantum Hall Regime''
entry.summary: This is a comment on a paper published by J.E. Mueller in Phys. Rev. Lett. 72, 2616 (1994).

author.name: J. Oswald
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Physics, University of Leoben, Austria

entry.title: A Topological Approach to Quantum Electrodynamics
entry.summary: The physical reasons in favour of a two dimensional topological model of quantum electrodynamics are discussed. It is shown that in accord with this model there is a new uncertainty relation for photon which is compatible with QED.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, Latex, The paper is revised

entry.title: Comment on ''Direct Current in Mesoscopic Rings Induced by High-Frequency Electromagnetic Field''
entry.summary: see cond-mat/0002050
entry.arxiv:comment: comment withdrawn and replaced by a longer paper, see cond-mat/0002050, and Superlattices and Microstructures 26, 367 (1999)

entry.title: Level statistics in a two-dimensional disc with diffusive boundary scattering
entry.summary: We calculate the energy level statistics in a two-dimensional disc with diffusive boundary scattering by the means of the recently proposed ballistic nonlinear sigma-model.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 2 figures submitted to Phys. Rev. B

entry.title: Classical absorption in small metal particles and thin films
entry.summary: We study the electric dipole absorption in small metal particles and thin films in a longitudnal electric field. In diffusive approximation, we give both the phenomenological and microscopic derivations with the account for Thomas-Fermi screening and Drude relaxation.

entry.title: Comment on "Possible Spin Polarization in a One-Dimensional Electron Gas"
entry.summary: Comment on K.J Thomas et al., Phys. Rev. Lett. 77, 135-138 (1996).
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, 2 figures, 16 references. This paper is related to cond-mat/9606004 and cond-mat/9806151

entry.title: Degeneracy of the lowest Landau level and quantum group of the quantum Hall effect on the Poincare half plane
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn by the author.

entry.title: Quantum squeezing micron-sized cantilevers
entry.summary: We show that substantial quantum squeezing of mechanical motion can be achieved for micron-sized cantilever devices fabricated using available techniques. A method is also described for measuring the cantilever fluctuation magnitudes in the squeezing regime.

entry.title: Comment on "Universality of the 1/3 shot-noise suppression factor in nondegenerate diffusive conductors"
entry.summary: We argue that the nearly 1/3 suppression of shot noise in nondegenerate diffusive contacts recently obtained by Gonzalez et al. (cond-mat/9803372) is due to the specific choice of the energy-independent elastic scattering time.

entry.title: An Unsettled Issue in the Theory of the Half-Filled Landau Level
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to identify an unsettled issue in the theory of the half-filled Landau level, and state our point of view.

entry.title: Mesoscopic coherence effect in superconductor-metallic ferromagnet structures
entry.summary: The boundary condition in Eq.6 is invalid.

entry.title: Quantization Of Cyclotron Motion and Quantum Hall Effect
entry.summary: We present a two dimensional model of IQHE in accord with the cyclotron motion. The quantum equation of the QHE curve and a new definition of filling factor are also given.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 Pages, Latex, 1 figure, to appear in Europhys. Lett. September 1999

entry.title: Johnson-Nyquist noise in narrow wires
entry.summary: The Johnson-Nyquist noise in narrow semiconducting wires having a transverse size smaller than the screening length is shown to be white up to frequency $D/L^2$ and to decay at higher frequencies as $\omega^{-{1/2}}$. This result is contrasted with the noise spectra in neutral and charged liquids.

entry.title: VanVleck Response Of A Two-Level System And Mesoscopic Orbital Magnetism Of Small Metals
entry.summary: We evaluate the mean value of the van Vleck response of a two-level system with level spacing distribution and argue that it describes the orbital magnetism of small conducting particles.

entry.title: Supercurrent noise in SNS junctions
entry.summary: Quasiclassical Green's functions of a short superconductor/normal metal/superconductor (SNS) junction are calculated for multi-mode junction with arbitrary electron transmission properties. They provide the basis for description of all of the junction transport characteristics, and are used to calculate the equilibrium spectral density of supercurrent fluctuations.

entry.title: Magnetization and Level Statistics at Quantum Hall Liquid-Insulator Transition in the Lattice Model
entry.summary: Statistics of level spacing and magnetization are studied for the phase diagram of the integer quantum Hall effect in a 2D finite lattice model with Anderson disorder.

entry.title: Carrier Scattering in Quantum Nanosystems
entry.summary: Carrier interaction with phonons, photons, impurities, and electrons have been addressed in semiconductor nanoscale systems with carrier confinement in one and two dimensions subjected to a quantizing magnetic field and without it.

entry.title: Reply to the Comment of Chudnovski and Garanin on Phonon assisted Tunneling in Mn_{12} (PRL 83, 416 (1999))
entry.summary: We reply to the comment of Chudnovsky and Garanin on the tunneling rate in Mn_{12}.

entry.title: Reply to the comment of Chudnovsky&Garanin on "Spin relaxation in Mn12-acetate"
entry.summary: Reply to the comment of E.M. Chudnovsky and D.A. Garanin on Europhys. Lett. 46, 692 (1999).

entry.title: Wigner-Dyson Statistics from the Keldysh Sigma-Model
entry.summary: The level statistics of disordered metallic grains with broken time reversal invariance is obtained from a saddle point analysis of the Keldysh nonlinear sigma-model.

entry.title: Coherent Tunneling in Fe-8 Molecular Nanomagnets: Response to the Comment by Bellessa (arXiv:cond-mat/0006441)
entry.summary: Response to the Comment by Bellessa (arXiv:cond-mat/0006441).

entry.title: Examining the Connection between Gauge Invariance and the Integral Quantum Hall Effect
entry.summary: We show the inconsistency of the argument linking the integral quantum Hall effect to gauge invariance. The inconsistency mainly consists of equating gauge and real vector potential transformations for a particular system geometry. Correct handling gives no Hall quantization.

entry.title: Dependence of the Fractional Quantum Hall Edge Critical Exponent on the Range of Interaction
entry.summary: Comment on A.M.Chang et al, PRL 86, 143 (2001).

entry.title: Fractional Charge
entry.summary: The origin and quantum status of Fractional Charge in polyacetylne and field theory are reviewed, along with reminiscences of collaboration with John Bell on the subject.
entry.arxiv:comment: Standard revtex format, 23 pages, no figures [ Invited Lecture at the International Conference "Quantum (Un)speakables" in honour of John Bell, held at Vienna, November 10-14, 2000. ]

entry.title: Comment on "Non-equilibrium Electron Distribution in Presence of Kondo Impurities" (cond-mat/0102150v2)
entry.summary: An inadequate approximation and its consequences as well as an incorrect statement made in cond-mat/0102150v2 are pointed out.

entry.title: First order phase transitions driven by in-plane magnetic field in odd-integral quantum Hall bilayer electron systems
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Non-existence of spin-asymmetry of conductance in two-terminal devices
entry.summary: This paper is Comment to the Letter "Oscillatory Spin-Filtering due to Gate Control of Spin-Dependent Interface Conductance", by D. Grundler (PRL 86, 1058 (2001)).

entry.title: Macroscopic quantum state reduction: uniting Bose-Einstein condensates by interference measurements
entry.summary: Two independently prepared condensates can be combined into a single larger condensate by detection of their relative phase in an intereference measurement.

entry.title: Reply to a Comment on ``Nonequilibrium Electron Distribution in Presence of Kondo Impurities'' (cond-mat/0105026)
entry.summary: Claims by Kroha and Zawadowski in cond-mat/0105026 on inadequate approximations and an incorrect statement in cond-mat/0102150 are shown to be based on oversimplified estimates and a false quotation.

entry.title: Quantum Phenomena in Low-Dimensional Systems
entry.summary: A brief summary of the physics of low-dimensional quantum systems is given. The material should be accessible to advanced physics undergraduate students. References to recent review articles and books are provided when possible.

entry.title: Some words on the "phase transitions" in magnetic mesoscopic system
entry.summary: "Phase transitions" between quantum and classical behaviour in large spin magnetic systems discused.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Physics of the Solid State, 42, Issue 2, pp. 280-284 (2000)

entry.title: Spectral determinant on graphs with generalized boundary conditions
entry.summary: The spectral determinant of the Schr\"odinger operator ($ - \Delta + V(x) $) on a graph is computed for general boundary conditions. ($\Delta$ is the Laplacian and $V(x)$ is some potential defined on the graph). Applications to restricted random walks on graphs are discussed.

entry.title: Comment on: "Even-odd behavior of conductance in monatomic sodium wires"
entry.summary: In this comment, we give a simple analytical proof for the even-odd behavior of the conductance of atomic wires.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, no figures, Revtex format. submitted to PRL

entry.title: Molecular nanomagnets in ac magnetic field
entry.summary: The behavior of molecular nanomagnets in periodic magnetic field transverse to the easy axis direction is investigated. It is shown that at sufficiently strong field the tunneling time can be considerably reduced.
entry.arxiv:comment: on the basis of the article accepted for publication in JMMM

entry.title: Reply to Comment on ``Quantum Pump for Spin and Charge Transport in a Luttinger Liquid''
entry.summary: We show that Feldman and Gefen's comment revolves around a trivial issue - the relative magnitudes for the two crossover scales in the problem.

entry.title: Spin stripes in nanotubes
entry.summary: It is shown here that electrons on the surface of a nanotube in a perpendicular magnetic field undergo spin-chirality separation along the circumference. Stripes of spin-polarization propagate along the tube, with a spatial pattern that can be modulated by the electron filling.

entry.title: Magnetoresistance of a mesoscopic tunneling quantum dot
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors, since the reference citation were not appropriately arranged.

entry.title: Landauer-like formula for dissipative tunneling
entry.summary: The Landauer formula for electrical conductance is simple but works remarkably well in mesoscopic systems. We propose a Landauer-like formula for calculating an escape rate out of a dissipative metastable well, the quantum Kramers rate.

entry.title: Comment on "Multi-phonon Raman scattering in semiconductor nanocrystals: Importance of non-adiabatic transitions"
entry.summary: In a recent paper [E. P. Pokatilov et al, PRB 65, 075316 (2002) the Raman selection rules in spherical nanocrystals with a degenerate valence band are analyzed. Some precisions are given here.
entry.arxiv:comment: 1 page, no figure. Commented paper also at cond-mat/0111282

entry.title: Analysis of integrated single-electron memory operation
entry.summary: Various aspects of single-electron memory are discussed. In particular, we analyze the single-electron charging by Fowler-Nordheim tunneling, propose the idea of background charge compensation, and discuss the defect-tolerant architecture based on nanofuses.

entry.title: Magnetic edge states of impenetrable stripe
entry.summary: The electron motion in a strong perpendicular magnetic field close to the impenetrable stripe is considered by making use of the singular integral equation technique. The energy spectrum is calculated and compared with the energy spectrum of the round antidot.

entry.title: Direct evidence of negative refraction at media with negative ε and μ
entry.summary: We analyze wave scattering by an interface between a positive refractive index medium and a Left-Handed Material. We show that the negative refraction effect can be deduced directly from Maxwell equations, without references to causality or losses.

entry.title: Disappearance of fractional statistics in Schrieffer-Wilczek theory
entry.summary: The paper of Arovas, Schrieffer and Wilczek is corrected. It is found that the Berry's phase is vanishingly small. Accordingly, the statistical vector potential becomes negligibly small.

entry.title: Nonequilibrium Kondo correlation in an interacting quantum dot with spin-flip scattering
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author(s)

entry.title: Comment on: "Current-voltage characteristics and zero-resistance state in 2DEG"
entry.summary: We demonstrate that N(S)-shape current-voltage characteristics proposed to explain zero-resistance state in Corbino(Hall bar) geometry 2DEG (cond-mat/0302063, cond-mat/0303530) cannot account essential features of radiation-induced magnetoresistance oscillations experiments.

entry.title: Reply to Comment on: ``Rashba precession in quantum wire with interaction''
entry.summary: It is shown that the recent Comment [cond-mat/0306019] by Y. Yu on the above article is not substantiated.

entry.title: An introduction to the quasiclassical theory of superconductivity for diffusive proximity-coupled systems
entry.summary: Chapter published in, "The Physics of Superconductors," Vol II, edited by Bennemann and Ketterson, Springer-Verlag, 2004.

entry.title: Quantum phase transitions in two-dimensional systems
entry.summary: Experimental data on quantum phase transitions in two-dimensional systems (superconductor-insulator, metal-insulator, and transitions under conditions of integer quantum Hall effect) are critically analyzed.

entry.title: Optical properties of a spherical 2D electron gas in the presence of a uniform magnetic field
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn by the authors.

entry.title: Optical properties of semiconductor nanostructures: decoherence versus quantum control
entry.summary: Optical spectroscopy and quantum control of semiconductor quantum dots has become a vivid field of research. The recent progress in both theory and experiment is reviewed, with emphasis on theoretical and computational concepts.

entry.title: Comment on cond-mat/0406502 by V. Yukalov and E. Yukalova on Coherent Nuclear Radiation
entry.summary: We show that the argument of Yukalov and Yukalova that dipole-dipole interaction prevents a system of magnetic dipoles from exhibiting superradiance unless assisted by a resonator is incorrect.

entry.title: Direct numerical observation of the Euclidean resonance
entry.summary: We present results of direct numerical calculations for the problem of quantum tunneling through the time-dependent potential barrier. Computations clearly demonstrate existence of the effect of the underbarrier resonance.

entry.title: Propagation of Light in Cantor Media
entry.summary: We numerically find that transmission coefficients have a rich structure as a function of wavelength in Cantor media. Complete transmission and complete reflection are observed. We also find that light propagation has scalings with respect to number of layers.

entry.title: Comment on "Spin-split two-dimensional electron gas perturbed by intense terahertz laser field"
entry.summary: We show that the time-dependent wavefunctions which serve as basis of the whole paper of Xu [Phys. Rev. B {\bf 70}, 193301 (2004)] are incorrect and point out the right ones.

entry.title: Reply to "Comment on Universal Decoherence in Solids"
entry.summary: The Comment of Openov (PRL 93, 158901 (2004)) on my Physical Review Letter (PRL 92, 120405 (2004)) does not affect the universality of the decoherence mechanism described in the Letter.

entry.title: Charge State Measurement and Persistent Current in a Double-Dot Aharonov Bohm Ring
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to a crucial error.

entry.title: Hyperfine effects in quantum wires
entry.summary: This paper has been removed.

entry.title: Flatland Electrons in High Magnetic Fields
entry.summary: This paper provides a review of developments in the physics of two-dimensional electron systems in perpendicular magnetic fields.
entry.arxiv:comment: Review paper, to be published in book series "High Magnetic Fields: Science and Technology" edited by Fritz Herlach and Noboru Miura, World Scientific Co

entry.title: Berry phase effects in magnetism
entry.summary: Lecture notes published in ''Magnetism goes nano'', Lecture Manuscripts of the 36th Spring School of the Institute of Solid State Research, edited by Stefan Bluegel, Thomas Brueckel, and Claus M. Schneider (Forschungszentrum Juelich, 2005).

entry.title: Spin dependent non-tunneling transport in granular ferromagnet
entry.summary: This paper is withdrawn.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors. A thoroughly revised version has appeared in Phys. Rev. B

entry.title: Reply to Comment on "Topological Oscillations of the Magnetoconductance in Disordered GaAs Layers"
entry.summary: Reply to A. M. M. Pruisken and I. S. Burmistrov: cond-mat/0504763

entry.title: Conductance of the elliptically shaped quantum wire
entry.summary: The conductance of a ballistic elliptically shaped quantum wire is investigated theoretically. It is shown that the effect of the curvature results in strong oscillating dependence of the conductance on the applied bias.

entry.title: Decoherence and Quantum Measurement of Josephson-Junction Qubits
entry.summary: This work deals with two pressing issues in the design and operation of Josephson qubits -- loss of coherence and measurement. (Longer abstract follows in the work.)

entry.title: The Superconducting Quantum Point Contact
entry.summary: 1. Introduction 2. Josephson current from excitation spectrum 3. Josephson current through a quantum point contact 4. Experimental realization
entry.arxiv:comment: #2 of a series of 4 legacy reviews on QPC's

entry.title: Comment on ``Four-Point Resistance of Individual Single-Wall Carbon Nanotubes'' by Gao et al. PRL 95, 196208 (2005)
entry.summary: We remark on some delicate points that attend the physical meaning of intrinsic device resistance.

entry.title: Superconducting qubits II: Decoherence
entry.summary: This is an introduction to elementary decoherence theory as it is typically applied to superconducting qubits.
entry.arxiv:comment: 41 pages, 3 figures; submitted to NATO-ASI proceedings "Manipulating quantum coherence in semiconductors and superconductors"

entry.title: Electron-Phonon Scattering in Semiconductor Structures with One-Dimensional Electron Gas
entry.summary: In this study a method for calculation of the electron-phonon scattering rate in semiconductor structures with one-dimensional electron gas is developed. The energy uncertainty of electrons is taken into account.

entry.title: Quantum Shot Noise
entry.summary: 1. Types of electrical noise 2. Measuring the unit of transferred charge 3. Quiet electrons 4. Detecting open transmission channels 5. Distinguishing particles from waves 6. Entanglement detector

entry.title: Time dependent transport phenomena
entry.summary: The aim of this review is to give a pedagogical introduction to our recently proposed ab initio theory of quantum transport.

entry.title: Numerical Analysis of the Anderson Localization
entry.summary: The aim of this paper is to demonstrate, by simple numerical simulations, the main transport properties of disordered electron systems.

entry.title: Comment on ``Dipole transitions and Stark effect in the charge-dyon system,'' by L. Mardoyan et al., cond-mat/0609768
entry.summary: We comment on recent e-print by L. Mardoyan et al. [cond-mat/0609768]

entry.title: Decoherence of a Spin Qubit Coupled with Spin Chain
entry.summary: In this report, we examine the relaxation phenomena of a spin qubit coupled to a spin chain with a $1/r^2$ interaction.

entry.title: de Haas-van Alphen effect versus Integer Quantum Hall effect
entry.summary: In frame of general stastical mechanics approach applied to 2D metal bar we demonstrate the interrelationship between Landau diamagnetism, de Haas-van Alphen magnetization oscillations and the Integer Quantum Hall effect.

entry.title: Enhanced quantum Zeno effect and bunching in the decay of interacting bosons from an unstable state
entry.summary: paper withdrawn due to the possible error in numerical eigenfunction calculation

entry.title: Evidence for high-temperature topological order in an asymmetric quantum Hall system
entry.summary: Further experiments showed the incorrectness of proposed interpretation.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author because further experiments showed the incorrectness of proposed interpretation

entry.title: Equilibrium properties of mesoscopic quantum conductors
entry.summary: Review article on equilibrium properties of mesoscopic quantum conductors.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Encyclopedia of Nanoscience and Nanotechnology, Vol. 3, p. 267-285 (2004)

entry.title: Caustics due to Negative Refractive Index in Circular Graphene p-n Junctions
entry.summary: We show that the wavefunctions form caustics in circular graphene p-n junctions which in the framework of geometrical optics can be interpreted with negative refractive index.

entry.title: Comment on PRL 99,140402 (2007) "Excitations in a nonequilibrium Bose Einstein Condensate of Exciton-polaritons" by M. Wouters and I. Carusotto
entry.summary: This comment has been withdrawn by the authors due to crucial error.

entry.title: Tripled composite fermion liquid in generalized Pfaffian of v=5/2 and non-abelian anyonic quasiholes with k=3
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, due to an important sign error in Eqn. 2.

entry.title: Spin fluctuation effect on the electron transport through a quantum point contact
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to inadequate formula Eq. (105) and following arguments.

entry.title: The zero-energy Landau levels in graphene as BPS-saturated states
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, due to the crucial mistake of the discussion in Sec IV.

entry.title: Origin of Spin Hall Effect (Reply to Comment)
entry.summary: Conceptual framework behind the intrinsic spin Hall effect in three-dimensional conductors is discussed. Theory suggests how the spin Hall current should depend on symmetry and orientation of the crystal.

entry.title: Correlation function of spectral staircase and particle number fluctuations in integrable systems
entry.summary: We evaluate the correlation function of the spectral staircase and use it to evaluate the mesoscopic particle number fluctuations in integrable systems.

entry.title: Low-Energy Conductivity of Single- and Double-Layer Graphene from the Uncertainty Principle
entry.summary: The minimum conductivity value as well as the linear dependence of conductivity on the charge density near the Dirac point in single and doublelayer graphene is derived from the energy-time uncertainty principle applied to ballistic charge carriers.

entry.title: Born Oppenheimer Dynamics Near Metal Surfaces
entry.summary: We discuss the usefulness of Born-Oppenheimer potential surfaces for nuclear dynamics for molecules strongly coupled to metal surfaces. A simple model demonstrating the construction of such surface for a molecular junction is discussed.

entry.title: Dynamical creation of gap in the monolayer graphene
entry.summary: The zero gap electronic bands in the monolayer graphene are shown to be unstable relative to the dynamic symmetry violation due to the electron-phonon interaction.

entry.title: Aharonov-Bohm effect in undoped graphene: Magnetotransport via evanescent waves
entry.summary: Using conformal mapping technique, compact and general analytic expressions for the effects of magnetic fluxes on conductance and Fano factor of undoped graphene nanoflakes in pseudodiffusive regime are derived.

entry.title: Transport in gapped bilayer graphene: the role of potential fluctuations (Supplementary Information)
entry.summary: Online Supplementary Information for arXiv:1008.0783
entry.arxiv:comment: Online Supplementary Information for arXiv:1008.0783, to appear in Physical Review B: Rapid Comm

entry.title: Defect Engineering: Graphene Gets Designer Defects
entry.summary: An extended one-dimensional defect that has the potential to act as a conducting wire has been embedded in another perfect graphene sheet.

entry.title: Replay to "Comment on 'Screening in gated bilayer graphene' "
entry.summary: We discuss the physics of the tunable bandgap in bilayer graphene with the gate voltage and doping. A comparison with experimental data obtained by Kuzmenko et al [Phys. Rev. B \textbf{80}, 165406 (2009)] demonstrates the good agreement.

entry.title: Effect of dielectric coating on the positron work function of a metal
entry.summary: We show that the dielectric coating of the metal surface leads to the change in the sign of the positron work function.

entry.title: Room temperature differential-conductance staircase in suspended graphitic quantum point contacts
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to pending experimental investigation to avoid certain potential experimental uncertainty.

entry.title: Anchoring ceria nanoparticles on reduced graphene oxide and their electronic transport properties
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Lattice Fluctuations Spectrum Calculation for P-dihlorbenzol Nanocrystals
entry.summary: We have measured spectra of lattice fluctuations in p-dihlorbenzol nanoparticles of ~300nm size. Calculations of lattice frequencies and of these fluctuations in nanoparticles are done. It is shown that with reduction of nanoparticles sizes the spectrum of superficial fluctuations becomes prevailing.

entry.title: Spin current induced by the sound wave
entry.summary: The kinetics of conduction electrons interacting with the field of sound waves in a constant magnetic field is studied. It is shown that the longitudinal sound wave propagation occurs transverse spin conductivity, which has a resonant character.

entry.title: Comment on "Floquet spin states in graphene under ac-driven spin-orbit interaction"
entry.summary: A comment on the paper by Lopez et al. [A. Lopez, Z. Z. Sun, and J. Schliemann, Phys. Rev. B 85, 205428 (2012)].

entry.title: Comment on "Laser-assisted spin-polarized transport in graphene tunnel junctions"
entry.summary: We comment on the latest paper [K.-H. Ding, Z.-G. Zhu, and J. Berakdar, J. Phys.: Condens. Matter 24, 266003 (2012)].

entry.title: A study on the surface states of a topological insulator: Bi2Se3
entry.summary: We have presented an introductory study on surface states of topological insulator, Bi2Se3 based on the first principle

entry.title: Spin Hall Effect
entry.summary: This is a brief review of the phenomenology of the spin Hall effect and related phenomena.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Future Trends in Microelectronics, S. Luryi, J. Xu, and A. Zaslavsky (eds), Wiley 2010, p. 251

entry.title: Macroscopic quantum tunneling and coherence of spins
entry.summary: We present a review of suppression of tunneling rate (energy splitting) for half-odd-integer spins in ferromagnetic and antiferromagnetic particles. We also review the quenching of the tunneling rate in the presence of a magnetic field.

entry.title: Spin polarization of electrons in quantum wires
entry.summary: The total energy of a quasi-one-dimensional electron system is calculated using density functional theory. It is shown that spontaneous ferromagnetic state in quantum wire occurs at low one-dimensional electron density. The critical electron density below which electrons are in spin-polarized state is estimated analytically.

entry.title: Spin flip of electron in static electric fields
entry.summary: The effects on the spin state of an electron in a time independent electric field are examined. The probability of spin flipping is calculated, and other effects are studied using the minimally coupled Dirac equation.

entry.title: Spin Sensitive Transmission Through Helical Potentials
entry.summary: We calculate the transmission coefficient for electrons passing through the helically shaped potential barrier, which can be, for example, produced by DNA molecules.

entry.title: A possible realization of multi-channel Kondo model in a system of magnetic chains
entry.summary: We discuss a possible realization of overscreened multi-channel Kondo model in quasi-one-dimensional magnets.

entry.title: Berry phase and the unconventional quantum Hall effect in graphene
entry.summary: The Berry phase of \pi\ in graphene is derived in a pedagogical way. The ambiguity of how to calculate this value properly is clarified. Its connection with the unconventional quantum Hall effect in graphene is discussed.

entry.title: Reply to Comment by Vanderbilt, Souza and Haldane: arXiv:1312.4200
entry.summary: We reassert our statement that the non-quantized Weyl node contribution to the anomalous Hall conductivity is not a Fermi surface property, contrary to the claim by Vanderbilt, Souza and Haldane.

entry.title: Reply to "Comment on "Fully covariant radiation force on a polarizable particle""
entry.summary: We reply to comment on recent paper by Pieplow and Henkel (New J. Phys. 15 (2013) 023027) and our results made by Volokitin and Persson (arXiv: 1405.2525)

entry.title: Comment on "Origin of Surface Canting within $\mathrm{Fe}_3\mathrm{O}_4$ Nanoparticles"
entry.summary: We comment on the Letter "Origin of surface canting within $\mathrm{Fe}_3\mathrm{O}_4$ nanoparticles" by K.L. Krycka et al. [Phys. Rev. Lett. $\bf 113$, 147203 (2014)].

entry.title: On thermoelectric figure of merit limits of superlattice materials
entry.summary: The paper deals with thermoelectric figure of merit of the superlattice materials. It is shown,that two-dimensional character of band spectrum of thermoelectric material may increase the power factor,but not the thermoelectric figure of merit.

entry.title: Computational Materials: III-V Semiconductor Clusters
entry.summary: Here, we review the progress in our understanding of the structure, and electronic spectra of InAs, GaAs, InSb and CdSe clusters. First principles approaches based on Hartree-Fock and Density Functional Theory have become central to such studies and a brief overview of them is given.

entry.title: Why all the fuss about 2D semiconductors?
entry.summary: Graphene is no longer alone; a family of atomically thin 2D semiconductors has emerged. Optoelectronics and photonics applications are in their experimental infancy but the future holds much promise.

entry.title: Optimization of p+-ZnTe layer for Back Contacts of ZnTe Thin Film Solar Cells
entry.summary: We have studied performance of ZnTe-based heterojunction diodes grown on p-GaAs substrates by pulsed laser deposition (PLD).

entry.title: Topological Semimetals
entry.summary: Topological semimetals and metals have emerged as a new frontier in the field of quantum materials. Novel macroscopic quantum phenomena they exhibit are not only of fundamental interest, but may hold some potential for technological applications.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 3 figures. Commentary article for Nature Materials

entry.title: Comment on arXiv:1705.01165 by V. N. Premakumar, M. G. Vavilov and R. Joynt
entry.summary: We comment on some aspects of the paper entitled "Evanescent-wave Johnson noise in small devices" recently posted by V. N. Premakumar, M. G. Vavilov and R. Joynt.

entry.title: Spectral Fluctuations in Disordered Metals
entry.summary: This is a review of the properties of spectral fluctations in disordered metals, their relation with Random Matrix Theory and semiclassical picture. We also review the physics of persistent currents in mesoscopic isolated rings, the parametric correlations and curvature distributions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 45 LateX pages, 15 postscript figures, Minor typos have been corrected and references updated
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Quantum Fluctuations, Les Houches, Session LXIII (1995), E. Giacobino, S. Reynaud and J. Zinn-Justin, eds., Elsevier Science

entry.title: Duality Near Quantum Hall Transitions
entry.summary: A recent experiment by Shahar et al, on the phase transitions between quantum Hall states and the insulator, found that the current-voltage characteristics in the two phases are related by symmetry. It was suggested in this work that this is evidence for charge-flux duality near quantum Hall transitions. Here we provide details of this analysis. (Appearances notwithstanding, this is a theoretical paper.)

entry.title: Current noise, electron-electron interactions, and quantum interference
entry.summary: It is shown that electron-electron interactions lead to a novel quantum-interference contribution to non-equilibrium current noise in mesoscopic conductors. The corresponding noise spectrum is obtained in detail for diffusive systems. It is found to be quadratic in the applied voltage and to exhibit a power-law frequency spectrum whose exponent depends on the dimensionality of the sample.

entry.title: An exact expression of the collective excitation energy gap of fractional quantum Hall effect
entry.summary: We have exactly solved the eigenequation of a two-dimensional Dirac fermion moving on the surface of a sphere under the influence of a radial magnetic field B, and obtained an exact expression of the collective excitation energy gap for the filling factors $\nu=p/(2mp\pm 1)$, m and p are non-zero integers, which is very well agreement with the computing results.

entry.title: Understanding the dynamics of fractional edge states with composite fermions
entry.summary: Fractional edge states can be viewed as integer edge states of composite fermions. We exploit this to discuss the conductance of the fractional quantized Hall states and the velocity of edge magnetoplasmons.

entry.title: Boundary Conditions for Bulk and Edge States in Quantum Hall Systems
entry.summary: For two dimensional Schroedinger Hamiltonians we formulate boundary conditions that split the Hilbert space according to the chirality of the eigenstates on the boundary. With magnetic fields, and in particular, for Quantum Hall Systems, this splitting corresponds to edge and bulk states. Applications to the integer and fractional Hall effect and some open problems are described.

entry.title: Random-Matrix Theory of Quantum Transport
entry.summary: This is a comprehensive review of the random-matrix approach to the theory of phase-coherent conduction in mesocopic systems. The theory is applied to a variety of physical phenomena in quantum dots and disordered wires, including universal conductance fluctuations, weak localization, Coulomb blockade, sub-Poissonian shot noise, reflectionless tunneling into a superconductor, and giant conductance oscillations in a Josephson junction.
entry.arxiv:comment: 85 pages including 52 figures, to be published in Rev.Mod.Phys

entry.title: Taming of the wild group of magnetic translations
entry.summary: We use a theorem of Auslander and Kostant on the representation theory of solvable Lie-groups for the study of some groups necessary for the description of certain quasi-periodic systems of solid-state physics. We show that the magnetic translation group is tame (Type I) if the magnetic field is not constant but fluctuating.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, to appear in the special issue "Mathematical Methods in Condensed Matter Physics" of J.Math.Phys

entry.title: Deformation of Quantum Dots in the Coulomb Blockade Regime
entry.summary: We extend the theory of Coulomb blockade oscillations to quantum dots which are deformed by the confining potential. We show that shape deformations can generate sequences of conductance resonances which carry the same internal wavefunction. This fact may cause strong correlations of neighboring conductance peaks. We demonstrate the relevance of our results for the interpretation of recent experiments on semiconductor quantum dots.

entry.title: Uncertainty Relation For Quantized Magnetic Fields and The Quantum Hall Effect
entry.summary: We discuss a model where the relation between Hall potential $A_H$ = and gate potential $A_G$, which is manifested by the stepped QHE = curve, is described by an uncertainty relation $\Delta A_H . = \Delta A_G =3D B(\hbar/e)$.

entry.title: Hall effect in NS and SNS junctions
entry.summary: Hall effect in SN and SNS junctions is considered. It is shown that at small temperature the Hall voltage is significantly suppressed as compared to its normal metal value. The time dependence of the Hall voltage in SNS junctions has a form of narrow pulses with the Josephson frequency.

entry.title: Theory of conductance and noise additivity in parallel mesoscopic conductors
entry.summary: We present a theory of conductance and noise in generic mesoscopic conductors connected in parallel, and we demonstrate that the additivity of conductance and of shot noise arises as a sole property of the junctions connecting the two (or more) conductors in parallel. Consequences on the functionality of devices based on the Aharonov-Bohm effect are also drawn.

entry.title: Noise in single quantum well infrared photodetectors
entry.summary: The spectral density of current fluctuations in single quantum well infrared photodetectors is calculated using Langevin approach. The noise gain and the photocurrent gain are expressed in terms of basic transport parameters. Fluctuations of the incident photon flux are taken into account.

entry.title: Current drag in capacitevly coupled Luttinger constrictions
entry.summary: We study the current drag in the system of two electrostatically coupled finite 1D electron channels. We present the perturbation theory results along with the results for two non-perturbative regimes. It is shown that the drag may become absolute, that is, the currents in the channels are equal in a finite window of the bias voltages.

entry.title: Nonequilibrium and Parity Effects in the Tunneling Conductance of Ultrasmall Superconducting Grains
entry.summary: Recent experiment on the tunneling spectra of ultrasmall superconducting grains revealed an unusual structure of the lowest differential conductance peak for grains in the odd charging states. We explain this behavior by nonequilibrium ``gapless'' excitations associated with different energy levels occupied by the unpaired electron. These excitations are generated by inelastic cotunneling.

entry.title: Magnetic Field Dependence of Magic Numbers in Small Quantum Dots
entry.summary: It is argued that various kind of shell structure which occurs at specific values of the magnetic field should be observable in small quantum dots in the addition energies and the magnetic susceptibility.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages (Latex file) including 4 epsi figures. For enquires see e-mail addresses at the end of the paper

entry.title: Tunneling and Universality in the Integer Quantum Hall Effect
entry.summary: We show analytically and numerically that omission of quantum interference from the Chalker-Coddington model of the integer quantum Hall effect gives a localization length exponent nu=4/3 as in ordinary two-dimensional percolation. Thus, contrary to semi-classical scaling arguments, tunneling alone does not lead to nu=7/3.

entry.title: Addition energies of a Quantum Dot with harmonic electron-electron interactions
entry.summary: We study a two dimensional electron system in a parabolic confining potential and constant magnetic field for the case of harmonic electron-electron interaction. We present analytic results for the electrochemical potential versus magnetic field and discuss the effects of correlation in connection with the addition energy of a Quantum Dot with few electrons.

entry.title: Thermal Crossover between Ultrasmall Double and Single Junction
entry.summary: The crossover from double-junction behavior to single-junction behavior of ultrasmall tunnel junctions is studied theoretically in a scanning-tunneling microscope setup. The independently variable tip temperature of the microscope is used to monitor the transition between both regimes.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages + 2 figures, LaTeX, using revtex.sty, epsf.sty, and multicol.sty

entry.title: Distribution of Transmitted Charge through an Ultrasmall Double-Tunnel Junction
entry.summary: The transmission of charge through an ultrasmall double junction is considered with Coulomb effects but at zero temperature. We construct an equation which describes the time development of the transmission probability of charges and solve this equation in terms of a recursion relation. The results are compared with the double junction without charging effects.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages + 3 figures, LaTeX, using revtex.sty, epsf.sty, and multicol.sty

entry.title: Evanescent modes in a multiple scattering factorization
entry.summary: We discuss differences between the exact S-matrix for scattering on serial structures and a known factorized expression constructed of single-element S-matrices. As an illustration, we use an exactly solvable model of a quantum wire with two point impurities.
entry.arxiv:comment: A LaTeX file, 10 pages, with one ps figure; to appear in Czech.J.Phys

entry.title: Decoherence and Quantum Fluctuations
entry.summary: We show that the zero-point fluctuations of the intrinsic electromagnetic environment limit the phase coherence time in all mesoscopic systems at low temperatures. We derive this quantum noise limited dephasing time and its temperature dependence in the crossover to the thermal regime. Our results agree well with most experiments in 1D systems.

entry.title: Energetics of Quantum Antidot States in Quantum Hall Regime
entry.summary: We report experiments on the energy structure of antidot-bound states. By measuring resonant tunneling line widths as function of temperature, we determine the coupling to the remote global gate voltage and find that the effects of interelectron interaction dominate. Within a simple model, we also determine the energy spacing of the antidot bound states, self consistent edge electric field, and edge excitation drift velocity.

entry.title: Hierarchical Wave Functions Revisited
entry.summary: We study the hierarchical wave functions on a sphere and on a torus. We simplify some wave functions on a sphere or a torus using the analytic properties of wave functions. The open question, the construction of the wave function for quasielectron excitations on a torus, is also solved in this paper.

entry.title: Shifts of Random Energy Levels by a Local Perturbation
entry.summary: We consider the effect of a local perturbation on the energy levels of a system described by random matrix theory. An analytic expression for the joint distribution function of initial and final energy levels is obtained. In the case of unitary ensemble we also find the two-point correlation function of initial and final densities of states.

entry.title: Dynamical Group for the Quantum Hall Effect
entry.summary: A dynamical group for the single-particle (non-interacting) Quantum Hall Effect is found, and used to describe the Landau levels and determine the transverse (Hall) current.

entry.title: Exchange interaction effects in inter-Landau level Auger scattering in a two-dimensional electron gas
entry.summary: We consider the influence of spin effects on the inter-Landau level electron-electron scattering rate in a two-dimensional electron gas. Due to the exchange spin splitting, the Landau levels are not equidistant. This leads to the suppresion of Auger processes and a nonlinear dependence of the lifetime on the concentration of the excited electrons even at very low excitation levels.

entry.title: Tunneling in very small GaAs MESFET
entry.summary: We study the transport through gated GaAS:Si wires of 0.5 micrometer length in the insulating regime and observe transport via elastic tunneling at very low temperature. We describe the mean positive magnetoconductance and the mesoscopic fluctuations of the conductance (versus energy or magnetic field) purely within one electron model without introducing Coulomb blockade considerations.

entry.title: Dynamic localization versus photon-assisted transport in semiconductor superlattices driven by dc-ac fields
entry.summary: Via the numerical analysis on the intraband dynamics of optically excited semiconductor superlattices, we find that time-integrated squared THz emission signals can be used for probing both dynamic localization and multi-photon resonance in the coherent regime. Competition effect between dynamic localization and photon-assisted transport has also been discussed.

entry.title: Keijsers, Shklyarevskii and van Kempen Reply
entry.summary: Answer to the Comment on ``Point-Contact Study of Fast and Slow Two-Level Fluctuators in Metallic Glasses'' by Jan von Delft et al.

author.name: R. J. P. Keijsers
author.arxiv:affiliation: Research Institute for Materials, University of Nijmegen

author.name: O. I. Shklyarevskii
author.arxiv:affiliation: Research Institute for Materials, University of Nijmegen

author.name: H. van Kempen
author.arxiv:affiliation: Research Institute for Materials, University of Nijmegen

entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, no figures, accepted Phys. Rev. Letters

entry.title: Localization Length from Single-Particle Properties in Disordered Electronic Systems
entry.summary: This preprint has been withdrawn as crucial errors have been discovered in the papers it has referred to. It is now superseded by cond-mat/9807391.

entry.title: Compressibility of a quantum Hall system at $ν= 1/2$
entry.summary: Despite the fact that composite fermions may be regarded as electrically neutral objects at Landua-level filling factor $\nu=1/2$, carrying only an electric dipole moment, we argue that the long-wavelength compressibility of the system is finite.
entry.arxiv:comment: RevTeX, 2 pages, no figures. Submitted as a comment to cond-mat/9702098, by Shankar and Murthy

entry.title: Shot Noise of Non-Interacting Composite Fermions
entry.summary: A simple equivalent circuit, which describes transport properties of a Two Dimensional Electron Gas in the Fractional Quantum Hall regime is presented. The physical justifications for this equivalent circuit are discussed in the frame work of the non-interacting Composite Fermions model. Quantum Shot Noise at an arbitrary filling factor and temperature is readily calculated.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 3 figures, one combined ps file

entry.title: Quantum Mott transition in a silicon quantum dot
entry.summary: Considering a double-barrier structure formed by a silicon quantum dot covered by natural oxide, we derive simple conditions for the conductance of the dot to become a step-like function of the number of doping atoms inside the dot, with negligible dependence on the actual position of the dopants. The found conditions are feasible in experimentally available structures.

entry.title: Comment on ``Two-dimensional charged-biexciton complexes''
entry.summary: We re-examine the results of A. Thilagam [Phys. Rev. B 55, 7804 (1997)], who calculated the ratio of the binding energies of the two dimensional exciton complexes. We point out that, for charged biexciton complexes, this calculation is oversimplified, and these systems do not always form bound states if they interact via pure Coulomb interaction. If experiment proved the existence of these objects, their bindings would have to be explained by other mechanisms.

entry.title: Hausdorff dimension and filling factor
entry.summary: We propose a new hierarchy scheme for the filling factor, a parameter which characterizes the occurrence of the Fractional Quantum Hall Effect (FQHE). We consider the Hausdorff dimension, $h$, as a parameter for classifying fractional spin particles, such that, it is written in terms of the statistics of the collective excitations. The number $h$ classifies these excitations with different statistics in terms of its homotopy class.

entry.title: Filling factors and Braid group
entry.summary: We extract the Braid group structure of a recently derived hierarchy scheme for the filling factors proposed by us which related the Hausdorff dimension, $h$, to statistics, $\nu$, of the collective excitations in the context of the Fractional Quantum Hall Effect (FQHE).

entry.title: Theoretical analysis of the resistively-coupled single-electron transistor
entry.summary: The operation of resistively-coupled single-electron transistor (R-SET) is studied quantitatively. Due to the Nyquist noise of the coupling resistance, degradation of the R-SET performance is considerable at temperatures $T$ as small as $10^{-3} e^2/C$ (where $C$ is the junction capacitance) while the voltage gain becomes impossible at $T\agt 10^{-2}e^2/C$.

entry.title: Coulomb blockade in superconducting quantum point contacts
entry.summary: Amplitude of the Coulomb blockade oscillations is calculated for a single-mode Josephson junction with arbitrary electron transparency $D$. It is shown that the Coulomb blockade is suppressed in ballistic junctions with $D\to 1$. The suppression is described quantitatively as the Landau-Zener transition in imaginary time.

entry.title: Vortex Drag in Quantum Hall Effect
entry.summary: A new model of momentum and electric field transfer between two adjacent 2D electron systems in the Quantum Hall Effect is proposed. The drag effect is due to momentum transfer from the vortex system of one layer to the vortex system of another layer. The remarkable result of this approach is periodical change of $sign$ of the dragged electric field with difference between the layer filling factors.

entry.title: Magnetic translation groups as group extension
entry.summary: Extensions of a direct product T of two cyclic groups Z_n1 and Z_n2 by an Abelian (gauge) group G with the trivial action of T on G are considered. All possible (nonequivalent) factor systems are determined using the Mac Lane method. Some of resulting groups describe magnetic translation groups. As examples extensions with G=U(1) and G=Z_n are considered and discussed.

entry.title: Nanosized superconducting constrictions
entry.summary: Nanowires of lead between macroscopic electrodes are produced by means of an STM. Magnetic fields may destroy the superconductivity in the electrodes, while the wire remains in the superconducting state. The properties of the resulting microscopic Josephson junctions are investigated.

entry.title: Scattering from objects immersed in a diffusive medium
entry.summary: The disturbance of the transmission of light through a diffusive medium due to an object hidden in it can be expressed in terms of an effective charge and dipole moment. In the mesoscopic regime, beyond the diffusion approximation, we calculate this effective charge and dipole moment. Various objects are considered: a single point scatterer, a localised density of such scatterers and a small sphere.

entry.title: Persistent current and correlation effects in carbon nanotubes
entry.summary: The persistent current of interacting electrons in toroidal single-wall carbon nanotubes is evaluated within Haldane's concept of topological excitations. The overall pattern of the persistent current corresponds to the constant interaction model, whereas the fine structure stems from the electronic exchange correlations.

entry.title: Fractional Quantum Hall Layer As A Magical Electromagnetic Medium
entry.summary: At a surface between electromagnetic media the Maxwell equations are consistent with either the usual boundary conditions, or exactly one alternative: continuity of E(perpendicular), H(perpendicular), D(parallel), B(parallel). These alternative, classically inexplicable conditions applied to the top and bottom surfaces of an FQH layer capture exactly its unique low-frequency properties.

entry.title: Strong tunneling and charge quantization in S-I-N Coulomb blockade structures
entry.summary: We study the charge of a small normal island connected by a tunnel junction to a superconducting lead. Unlike the N-I-N case, the steps of the Coulomb staircase remain sharp even if the conductance of the tunneling barrier exceeds e^2/h. One can observe the transition from sharp steps to the smeared ones by applying magnetic field to destroy the superconductivity.

entry.title: Anomalous mesoscopic fluctuations of transport coefficients above the critical temperature
entry.summary: We show that above the critical temperature of superconductor - metal phase transitions, both the longitudinal and Hall conductivity exhibit strong temperature dependent mesoscopic fluctuations, with amplitudes much larger than the mesoscopic fluctuations in noninteracting normal metals. Such an enhancement of the mesoscopic fluctuations arises from pairing correlations and is strongly dependent on dimensions.

entry.title: Observation of the Metal-Insulator Transition in Two-Dimensional n-type GaAs
entry.summary: The observation of a carrier-density driven metal-insulator transition in n-type GaAs-based heterostructure is reported. Although weaker than in comparable-quality p-type GaAs samples, the main features of the transition are rather similar.

entry.title: Mesoscopic mechanism of adiabatic charge transport
entry.summary: We consider adiabatic charge transport through mesoscopic metallic samples caused by a periodically changing external potential. We find that both the amplitude and the sign of the charge transferred through a sample per period are random sample specific quantities. The characteristic magnitude of the charge is determined by the quantum interference.

entry.title: Level Correlations And Persistent Currents In Mesoscopic Metals
entry.summary: We use the exact correlation function of the density of energy levels in the magnetic field to evaluate persistent currents in mesoscopic metals. We also analyze the perturbation theory limit of the correlation function vis-a-vis the perturbation theory limit of the orbital response.

entry.title: Reply to Comment on "Localization and Metal-Insulator Transition in Multilayer Quantum Hall Structures"
entry.summary: This is a Reply to a Comment by Tanaka and Machida. We provide some details of the derivation of the effective field theory for integer quantum Hall transitions using the non-Abelian chiral anomaly.

entry.title: Mesoscopic fluctuations of tunneling through double quantum dots
entry.summary: We study fluctuations of conductance of two connected in series dots in the Coulomb blockade regime. The pattern of the fluctuations turns out to be extremely sensitive to a magnetic field. These conductance fluctuations also provide information about the mesoscopic fluctuations of charge of a partially-opened single quantum dot, which are hard to measure directly.

entry.title: On loss of quantum coherence in an interacting Fermi gas
entry.summary: We clarify the path integral calculation, recently suggested by Golubev and Zaikin, and show, contrary to their claim, that quasiparticles become fully coherent quantum particles in the $T \to 0$ limit. The important physical point is the inclusion of the recoil of the quasiparticle when interacting with fluctuations in the rest of the Fermi gas.

entry.title: Fractional Quantization and Fractional Quantum Hall Effect
entry.summary: A fractional quantization in a two dimensional space is proposed. The angular momenta of the two dimensional electrons are quantized in fractional numbers by the boundary conditions on a multi-layered Riemann surface. Extended wave functions for the incompressible quantum fluid states are presented and the cohesive and the excitation energies are given.

author.name: Hyeong Rag Lee
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dept. of Phys, KNU, Taegu, Korea

entry.title: Properties of superconductor - Luttinger liquid hybrid systems
entry.summary: In this paper we review some recent results concerning the physics of superconductor - Luttinger liquid proximity systems. We discuss both equilibrium (the pair amplitude, Josephson current, and the local density of states) and nonequilibrium (the subgap current) properties.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, submitted to Superlattices and Microstructures
